content.description:
Question refers to the following images.

© Pitt Rivers Museum, University of Oxford

© Pitt Rivers Museum, University of Oxford
content.question:
The images show two views of the same work.

Correctly attribute the work shown to the specific culture from the Indigenous Americas (1000 B.C.E.–1980 C.E.) in which it was created.

Using specific visual evidence, justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities in both form and content between the work shown and another work of the same type created by the same culture.

Using specific contextual evidence, explain the function of this type of work.

Using specific visual or contextual evidence, explain how the function shaped either the form or the content of this type of work.

frqParts.text:
The images show two views of the same work.

Correctly attribute the work shown to the specific culture from the Indigenous Americas (1000 B.C.E.–1980 C.E.) in which it was created.

Using specific visual evidence, justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities in both form and content between the work shown and another work of the same type created by the same culture.

Using specific contextual evidence, explain the function of this type of work.

Using specific visual or contextual evidence, explain how the function shaped either the form or the content of this type of work.

topic.text: 5.3: Purpose and Audience in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
